cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi (115 km) south-southeast of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, expected to turn northeast later today and accelerate parallel to the U.S. East Coast toward the North Carolina Outer Banks, then offshore toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Outer Banks of North Carolina (around Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch north of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, parts of Chesapeake Bay, tidal Potomac, and portions of southeastern Massachusetts
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Savannah River GA to NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical-storm warning NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from Georgia through the Carolinas and into Virginia; later New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions and occasional squalls are expected; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at Port Everglades
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered showers with light accumulations; widespread heavy rainfall is not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will continue along the southeast Florida coast
